required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effect of Empagliflozin vs Dapagliflozin Over Pulse Wave Velocity in Type Two Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effect of Empagliflozin vs Dapagliflozin vs Placebo Administration Over Pulse Wave Velocity in Patients With Type Two Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: Centro Universitario de Ciencias de la Salud, Mexico

clinical_study.source: Centro Universitario de Ciencias de la Salud, Mexico

brief_summary.textblock: To date one of the main independent biomarkers of cardiovascular disease is the arterial stiffness parameters measured by carotid-femoral pulse wave velocity. It is known that SGLT2 inhibitors develop cardiac protection over long term administration, but there's not enough studies about acute effects in early administration.

detailed_description.textblock: Measure basal carotid-femoral Pulse Wave Velocity through a Pulse Pen tonometer by DiaTecne among basic physical examination, blood test, anthropometric and hemodynamic measurements; then administrate randomly dapagliflozin 10 mg, empagliflozin 25 mg or placebo for 7 days and then perform all of the measurements and blood test again.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline carotid-femoral pulse wave velocity at 7 days. Using a PulsePen tonometer by DiaTechne.

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® Glucose Oxidase / Peroxidase kit; in an automated clinical chemistry analysis equipment brand XL-100Erba
Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® Glucose Oxidase / Peroxidase kit.
Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® Glycerol phosphate Oxidase / Peroxidase kit.
Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® Direct / Detergent HDL kit
Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® Cholesterol Oxidase / Peroxidase kit
Change from baseline, using the BioSystems® kit Modified Jaffe's no deproteinization

Change from baseline, using an OMRON calibrated electronic digital sphygmomanometer model HEM 907 XL. The patient will remain seated in a chair resting his back on the backrest, with a minimum rest of 5 minutes, The average of 3 measurements such as BP will be taken

arm_group.description: Dapagliflozin is an oral medication used to treat Type 2 diabetes. It belongs to a sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors.
Empagliflozin is an oral medication used to treat Type 2 diabetes. It belongs to sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors.
Calcinated magnesium is a white powdery compound, MgO, used in pharmaceuticals as binder.

intervention.description: Daily morning dose per oral of Dapagliflozin 10 mg for 7 days
Daily morning dose per oral of Empagliflozine 25 mg for 7 days
Daily morning dose per oral of Calcined magnesite 500 mg for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of T2DM
- HbA1c > 7 y < 10
- BMI 25 - 34.9 kg/m2
- Signature of consent under information
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypertension
- Treated with insulin and / or loop diuretics and thiazides
- T1DM
- Hypotension
- Any autoimmune disease
- Liver disease
- Women whitout birth control method
- Women taking oral birth control or under hormone replacement therapy
- Woman pregnant or breastfeeding
- Untreated thyroid disease
- Patients with a cardiovascular disease that contraindicates the use of this pharmacological class
- Glomerular filtration rate <60ml/min (Cockcroft-Gault)

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Experimental and Clinical Therapeutics (INTEC), CUCS

facility.name: Institute of Experimental and Clinical Therapeutics (INTEC), CUCS, University of Guadalajara

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centro Universitario de Ciencias de la Salud, Mexico
